sentences.en: 'Come in, Mr Dance,'says he, very stately and condescending.
sentences.cn: “ 进来, 丹斯先生.”他摆着架子非常庄重地说.

sentences.en: Can't you see how condescending you are when you say that?
sentences.cn: 难道你看不出来你说刚才那些话的时候是多么的目中无人吗?

sentences.en: He gave her a critical and condescending look - over.
sentences.cn: 他用迁就的眼光细细地端详了她一下.

sentences.en: He has a condescending attitude towards women.
sentences.cn: 他对女性总是居高临下。

sentences.en: He tends to adopt a condescending manner when talking to young women.
sentences.cn: 和年轻女子说话时,他喜欢摆出一副高高在上的姿态.

sentences.en: His condescending attitude really gets my back up.
sentences.cn: 他那种居高临下的恩赐态度实在使我很生气.

sentences.en: I didn't like his tone of voice; I felt he was being condescending.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢他说话的腔调, 我觉得他好像很屈尊一样.

sentences.en: I didn't mean to sound condescending.
I patted the top of her head in the condescending way I knew irritated the hell out of her.
sentences.cn: 我故意俯就地拍了拍她的头顶，知道这会让她非常恼火。

sentences.en: I'm fed up with your money and your whole condescending attitude.
sentences.cn: 我讨厌你的钱，也受够了你居高临下的态度。

sentences.en: If you find this attitude obnoxious condescending, or arrogant, check your assumptions.
sentences.cn: 如果你觉得我们过于傲慢的态度让你不爽,让你委屈, 不妨设身处地想想.

sentences.en: Nevertheless, Thatcher's sometimes hectoring, sometimes condescending manner irritated many voters.
sentences.cn: 尽管如此, 撒切尔的风格还是惹恼了许多选民.

sentences.en: Professor Hutter’s manner is extremely conde-scending.
sentences.cn: 赫特教授的态度极为傲慢。

sentences.en: She added, as if condescending to his natural shyness: " I've never seen May looking lovelier. "
sentences.cn: 她象是为了迁就他那天生的羞怯,于是补充道: “ 我发现梅从来没象今天这样漂亮可爱. ”

sentences.en: They can be a bit condescending.
You should never make the mistake of condescending to your employees.
sentences.cn: 你绝不能居高临下地对待你的雇员.

words.tran_cn: 谦逊的；故意屈尊的；有优越感的

trans.tran_cn: 降低身份的，屈尊的，高傲的，傲慢的
trans.tran_en: behaving as though you think you are better, more intelligent, or more important than other people – used to show disapproval

trans.tran_cn: 屈尊，俯就( condescend的现在分词 )，故意表示和蔼可亲
